exercise.title: 09.04 Minigolf
exercise.p: The cottage guests were playing minigolf. Make a program that that tells the smallest (winner) and biggest (last one) results.The results for the eight players are in the array below: var minigolf = [23, 19, 37, 20, 21, 30, 26, 24];

ul.li: Write the code into a script element inside of the body element
Sort the array with the sort() method. Then the smallest result is at the index 0.

How to get the last item then? The length of the array is minigolf.length. Taking into consideration that indexes start from 0 and not from 1, what is the index of the last one? Use the minigolf.length in calculating the last index. Hint: With 3 items (length 3), indexes are 0,1,2. With 5 items (length 5) indexes are 0,1,2,3,4. How do you calculate the last index from the length property then, no matter what is the length?

exercise.p: Submit a link to your code (myy or jsbin).
